str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Humility, lowliness of mind, modesty. From a compound of tapeinos and the base of phren; humiliation of mind, i.e. Modesty.
Mildness, gentleness. From praus; mildness, i.e. humility.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Patience, forbearance, longsuffering. From the same as makrothumos; longanimity, i.e. forbearance or fortitude.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
